thread.title: Comment on Gregg Popovich named future head coach of Team USA by BBR
thread.title_full: Comment on Gregg Popovich named future head coach of Team USA by BBR

author: BBR
title: Comment on Gregg Popovich named future head coach of Team USA by BBR
text:
Article written by Mrs. Tyler Thompson No, I will not make you a sandwich, but you can follow me on Twitter @MrsTylerKSR or email me . 11 responses to “Gregg Popovich named future head coach of Team USA” October 23, 2015 at 12:41   
Damn, he’s gonna be really old in 20120! Big Mike In the Wood October 23, 2015 at 12:44   
So is this good news or bad news for Demarcus Cousins Olympic future? I know he wants to be on that team badly. za October 23, 2015 at 1:45 pm | Permalink 
Surely he won’t get left off this time Bluebros October 23, 2015 at 12:59   
Not much of a drop off from Coach K to Pop! Future is looking bright for Team USA. Would have been nice to see Cal but really, not anyone else respected more in the NBA than Coach Popovich. I see a lot more gold in the future BBR October 23, 2015 at 3:43 pm | Permalink 
Major improvement over krybaby. Glad to see him go. Biggest phony in the game. footblue October 23, 2015 at 1:04   
Great move. they will play real basketball! BAdams October 23, 2015 at 1:05   
It’s best it is an NBA coach. No recruiting advantages there. Plus, he’s one of the best. JaredCarterIsMyHomeboy October 23, 2015 at 1:06   
He could always croak before then. That’s a long time off, and Pop isn’t getting any younger. Side Show Bob October 23, 2015 at 1:20   
Good choice. I was wrong (that’s happened once before). I didn’t think he would be chosen because of his age. He’s a proven winner who is respected by everyone is the game. He’ll probably only be around for an Olympics maybe two. I could be wrong….again. UKBlue October 23, 2015 at 1:22   
Yea the powers that be were never ever ever going to allow Cal to be the coach. Lol October 23, 2015 at 2:05 pm | Permalink 
What? Pop vs. Cal and you think it’s politics? Pop is widely regarded as the best coach in the NBA and one of the best of all time. Long time reader of KSR and avid UK fan, but jesus, not everyone is out to get Cal/UK Post Comment - New and Improved (not really, it just works now)
